events.title: Robert E. Lee's Birth
events.description: Robert E. Lee, who would become the Confederate general during the American Civil War, was born in Virginia.
events.significance: Lee's leadership and military strategies were pivotal in the Civil War, impacting American history deeply.

events.title: First Zeppelin Air Raid on Britain
events.description: During World War I, German zeppelins conducted their first air raid on Britain, targeting the eastern counties, causing damage and civilian casualties.
events.significance: This event marked the beginning of strategic aerial bombing campaigns and shaped wartime defense approaches.

events.title: The League of Nations Holds Its First Council Meeting
events.description: The League of Nations, established after World War I to maintain world peace, held its first council meeting in Paris.
events.significance: An early attempt at international diplomacy and collective security, influencing future international organizations like the United Nations.

events.title: Ellen Johnson Sirleaf Elected President of Liberia
events.description: Ellen Johnson Sirleaf became the first elected female head of state in Africa, winning the presidency in Liberia.
events.significance: Her election represented a milestone for gender equality and democratic progress in Africa.
